title: STUDY
description: A STUDY (a.k.a. Clinical Trial) is a research project whose objectives are to test or confirm hypotheses concerning the utility, impact, pharmacological, physiological, and/or psychological effects of a particular treatment, procedure, drug, device, biologic, food product, cosmetic, care plan, or subject characteristic. The terms clinical trial and clinical study are synonymous.

biNumber.title: biStudyNumber
biNumber.description: Study Number is the BI internal number of the STUDY.

edccaptureflag.title: electronicDataCaptureTrialFlag
edccaptureflag.description: Indicates whether this study works with electronic data capture (true) or not (false).

eprostudy.title: electronicPatientReportedOutcomesFlag
eprostudy.description: Indicates whether this study works with electronic reporting for patient outcomes.

eudractNumber.title: eudractNumber
eudractNumber.description:
The EudraCT registry number assigned to the study, if applicable.
The number is composed of three parts: YYYY-NNNNNN-CC
•	YYYY - The year
•	NNNNNN - A six digit number
•	CC - Two control digits

hcpflag.title: humanPharmacologyCenterStudyFlag
hcpflag.description: Indicates whether this study takes place at a Human Pharmacology Center only (true) or not (false).

shortTitle.title: shortTitle
shortTitle.description: A short title that may be the same as the study abbreviation.

status.title: status
status.description: The status is the assigned status of the newest Important Dates of the Study.

title.title: studyTitle
title.description: The official, full-fledged title that is given on the study protocol pertaining to a specific study.

developmentProjectImpactId.title: developmentProject.impactProjectId
developmentProjectImpactId.description: Unique ID of the development project given automatically by the CTMS

importantDates.title: importantDates
importantDates.description:
An IMPORTANT DATE is a milestone or a planned event which will be specialized for the different scopes of IMPORTANT DATE; e.g. IMPORTANT DATE FOR STUDY, IMPORTANT DATE FOR STUDY COUNTRY, IMPORTANT DATE FOR STUDY SITE., ....
An IMPORTANT DATE is typificated by IMPORTANT DATE TYPE.

personnel.title: individualClinicalDevelopmentFunctions
personnel.description:
INDIVIDUAL CLINICAL DEVELOPMENT FUNCTION defines the role executed by an employee of Boehringer or a CRO in the context of clinical operations. 
INDIVIDUAL CLINICAL DEVELOPMENT FUNCTION is specialized in INDIVIDUAL CLINICAL DEVELOPMENT FUNCTION FOR STUDY, INDIVIDUAL CLINICAL DEVELOPMENT FUNCTION FOR STUDY COUNTRY, INDIVIDUAL CLINICAL DEVELOPMENT FUNCTION FOR STUDY SITE. 
The values (roles types) are defined by INDIVIDUAL CLINICAL DEVELOPMENT FUNCTION TYPE.

studyCountries.title: studyCountries
studyCountries.description:
A STUDY COUNTRY describes the contribution of patients from a specific country to a study. The patients are assumed to be "supplied" from one geographical country and their contribution is managed by a designated CML. This CML does not necessarily need to be located within the country supplying the patients.
The contribution brings together a set of information (planning and monitoring relevant) from different areas. It is in general always a pair of CML/Country. Via the CML role assignment, the responsible company can be derived.
This combination implies which BI Company is responsible for planning and tracking on external costs for the countries/sites it is assigned to. In a regional setting, the OPU with regional scope (like e.g. RA for South America) may take on financial responsibility for a multitude of countries in SA during a given study.
It is to be noted, however, that the monitoring responsibility of the CML might not correspond to the financial responsibility. It might be decided to have one regional CML only or one CML for two countries and one for each remaining country.

ClinicalTrialDesign.title: clinicalTrialDesign
ClinicalTrialDesign.description: Plan for the precise procedure to be followed in a clinical trial, including planned and actual timing of events, choice of control group, method of allocating treatments, blinding methods; assigns a subject to pass through one or more epochs in the course of a trial. Specific design elements are taken in consideration (e.g., crossover, parallel, doseescalation). Includes also Administrative Activity which is defined at a global library level that is independent of a study subject but is necessary for the conduct of the CLINICAL TRIAL. CLINICAL TRIAL DESIGN is linked to a CLINICAL TRIAL PROTOCOL.
